filesystem

Class Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.FSElement
      • filesystem.Directory

  • public class Directory
extends FSElement
    Represents a directory which can contain files and directories.
    Author:
    anton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Directory(java.lang.String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new directory given the name of the directory and its parent.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(FSElement child)
      Adds the given fselement child to itself overwriting if something with the same name existed before.
      boolean containsChildDirectory(java.lang.String name)
      Gets if a directory with name is a child directory.
      boolean containsChildElement(java.lang.String name)
      Gets if an element with name is a child of the directory.
      boolean containsChildFile(java.lang.String name)
      Gets if a file with name is a child file.
      FSElement copy()
      Clones the current Directory as well as all its children elements.
      Directory createAndAddNewDir(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a given directory as a child of this directory if the directory does not already exist.
      File<?> createAndAddNewFile(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a given file as a child of this directory if the file does not already exist otherwise raises error.
      File<?> createAndAddNewFile(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String contents)
      Adds a given file as a child of this directory if the file does not already exist otherwise raises error.
      FSElement getChildByName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a child FS element by name.
      Directory getChildDirectoryByName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a child directory by name.
      File getChildFileByName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a child file by name.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Provides the name of this directory.
      Directory getParent()
      Gets the parent of this directory.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> listAllChildrenNames()
      Lists all children names (files and directories) inside of this directory.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> listDirNames()
      Lists all the directory names inside of this directory.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> listFileNames()
      Lists all the file names inside of this directory.
      void moveInto(FSElement newChild)
      Moves the given fselement into the current directory as long as nothing with the same name already exists.
      void notifyRename(java.lang.String oldName, java.lang.String newName)
      Changes the key for an FSElement when it is renamed.
      void removeChildByName(java.lang.String name)
      Removes a child directory with the given name if it exists.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public void addChild(FSElement child)
        Adds the given fselement child to itself overwriting if something with the same name existed before.
        Parameters:
        child - The child to be added.

      • moveInto

        public void moveInto(FSElement newChild)
              throws FSElementAlreadyExistsException
        Moves the given fselement into the current directory as long as nothing with the same name already exists.
        Parameters:
        newChild - The child to move into this directory.
        Throws:
        FSElementAlreadyExistsException - if there is already a child with the same name.

      • createAndAddNewDir

        public Directory createAndAddNewDir(java.lang.String name)
                             throws FSElementAlreadyExistsException
        Adds a given directory as a child of this directory if the directory does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new child directory.
        Returns:
        Returns the new created directory.
        Throws:
        FSElementAlreadyExistsException - Thrown when there is already an element with this name.

      • createAndAddNewFile

        public File<?> createAndAddNewFile(java.lang.String name)
                            throws FSElementAlreadyExistsException
        Adds a given file as a child of this directory if the file does not already exist otherwise raises error.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child file to create.
        Returns:
        The new file object that was created.
        Throws:
        FSElementAlreadyExistsException - Thrown when the file already exists.

      • createAndAddNewFile

        public File<?> createAndAddNewFile(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String contents)
                            throws FSElementAlreadyExistsException
        Adds a given file as a child of this directory if the file does not already exist otherwise raises error.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child file to create.
        contents - The initial contents of the new file.
        Returns:
        The new file object that was created.
        Throws:
        FSElementAlreadyExistsException - Thrown when the file already exists.

      • removeChildByName

        public void removeChildByName(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a child directory with the given name if it exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child to remove.

      • getChildByName

        public FSElement getChildByName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a child FS element by name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child wanted.
        Returns:
        The child with the given name or null if it does not exist.

      • containsChildElement

        public boolean containsChildElement(java.lang.String name)
        Gets if an element with name is a child of the directory.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns true iff a child element with name exists.

        Returns:

        Returns:
        Returns true iff a child file with name exists.

      • notifyRename

        public void notifyRename(java.lang.String oldName,
                         java.lang.String newName)
        Changes the key for an FSElement when it is renamed.
        Parameters:
        oldName - The old name of the child.
        newName - The new name of the child.

      • copy

        public FSElement copy()
        Clones the current Directory as well as all its children elements. Warning: when cloning, the new instance is unlinked (ie the parent directory has no record of it as its child).
        Overrides:
        copy in class FSElement
        Returns:
        Returns the cloned instance.
